title: 112_hr1447
content: The "Aviation Security Stakeholder Participation Act of 2012" may be cited as the Aviation Security Advisory Committee. The Aviation Security Advisory Committee is established within the Transportation Security Administration to advise on aviation security matters, policies, and directives. The Aviation Security Advisory Committee advises the Assistant Secretary on aviation security policies, programs, and recommendations for improvements. The Aviation Security Advisory Committee develops recommendations for improvements to aviation security, which are approved by working groups and transmitted to the Assistant Secretary periodically. The Aviation Security Advisory Committee's recommendations are approved by working groups and transmitted to the Assistant Secretary for approval. The Advisory Committee also submits periodic reports on identified matters and an annual report to the Assistant Secretary. The Advisory Committee reports on matters identified by the Assistant Secretary and majority members, submitting an annual report on activities, findings, and recommendations. Membership appointments must be made within 180 days of the section's enactment. The Advisory Committee, including its working groups, reports on activities, findings, and recommendations from the preceding year. Membership appointments must be made within 180 days of the section's enactment, with representation from up to 27 member organizations. The Secretary appoints members of the Advisory Committee, consisting of up to 27 representatives from different member organizations in the aviation industry. The Advisory Committee consists of representatives from various sectors in the aviation industry, including air carriers, labor organizations, aircraft manufacturers, and airport operators. The Assistant Secretary has the authority to remove a member for cause at any time. The Advisory Committee in the aviation industry covers aviation technology security, privacy, and biometrics. The Assistant Secretary can remove members for cause and they do not receive compensation. Meetings are required at least semiannually. The Advisory Committee members are prohibited from receiving compensation from the Government. Meetings must be held at least semiannually, with additional meetings as needed. An air cargo security working group will be established within the Advisory Committee to provide recommendations on air cargo security issues. The Advisory Committee will meet at least semiannually and may convene additional meetings as necessary. An air cargo security working group will be established within the Committee to provide recommendations on air cargo security issues, including the implementation of security programs for screening air cargo on passenger and all-cargo aircraft. The air cargo security working group will meet quarterly to provide recommendations on air cargo security, including screening programs for passenger and all-cargo aircraft. Recommendations will be included in the annual report to improve cargo security initiatives. The air cargo security working group meets quarterly to provide recommendations on air cargo security to the Advisory Committee. Recommendations aim to improve cargo security initiatives established to meet specific requirements. The group includes members with expertise in air cargo operations and is cochaired by a Government and industry official. The Assistant Secretary will establish a general aviation security working group within the Advisory Committee to provide recommendations on security issues for general aviation facilities, aircraft, and helicopter operations at airports. The group will include members with expertise in general aviation and will be cochaired by a Government and industry official. The Assistant Secretary will establish a general aviation working group within the Advisory Committee to provide recommendations on transportation security issues for general aviation facilities, aircraft, and helicopter operations at airports. The group will meet quarterly and submit information to the Advisory Committee for inclusion in the annual report. The Assistant Secretary will establish a perimeter security working group within the Advisory Committee for general aviation airports. The group will meet quarterly, include experts in general aviation, and be cochaired by a Government and industry official. The perimeter security working group within the Advisory Committee for general aviation airports will include experts in general aviation and be cochaired by a Government and industry official. Meetings will be held quarterly to provide recommendations on airport perimeter security and access control issues. The Assistant Secretary will establish an airport perimeter security working group within the Advisory Committee to provide recommendations on improving perimeter security and access control procedures at commercial service and general aviation airports. The working group will meet quarterly and submit information to the Advisory Committee for inclusion in the annual report. The airport perimeter security working group will meet quarterly to provide recommendations on improving perimeter security and access control procedures at airports. The group will include members with expertise in these issues and be cochaired by a Government and industry official. The Aviation Security Advisory Committee will include members with expertise in airport perimeter security and access control issues, cochaired by a Government and industry official. The Federal Advisory Committee Act does not apply to this committee. Definitions for "Advisory Committee" and "annual report" are provided in this section. The Aviation Security Advisory Committee will be established with members specializing in airport perimeter security and access control. Definitions for "Advisory Committee," "annual report," and "Assistant Secretary" are provided in this section. The curr_chunk defines "Assistant Secretary" as the Assistant Secretary of Homeland Security (Transportation Security Administration) and "perimeter security" as procedures to monitor and secure airport access. A clerical amendment is made to the analysis for the subchapter. The curr_chunk states the passing of the Aviation Security Advisory Committee in the House of Representatives on June 28, 2012.
